entry.title: GB Customer account set up with EU VAT registration
entry.content:
Hi all,

Hoping you can offer advise on customer account set up & partner function as GB companies are setting up with EU VAT registrations. My example is GB company with fiscal rep in Germany ( so just DE VAT ID, no PE) . Customer account with GB address and offering a German VAT registration to zero rate deliveries to EU from my EU factories. SAP failing to identify a GB company address and will not accept DE VAT registration unless country code changed to DE ( which seems correct ) but now SAP has a mandatory field for post code( I do not have a German address) . Updating GB company with DE VAT number not working as partner function and DE VAT number not appearing on invoice. Looking for better solution, hoping you can offer advise or alternative

entry.title: S/4HANA Public Cloud – Error when creating billing document with future billing date from preliminar
entry.content:
Hi experts,

I’m working in Sales in S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, using the Manage Preliminary Billing Documents app.

For a preliminary billing document (type F2) with billing date 29.11.2025 and status Finalized, when I select it and choose Create Billing Documents, if I enter a future billing date (for example 01.12.2025) the system raises the error:

Document cannot be posted for the date 20251201, date should be less than 20251128.

My question is: which configuration or restriction is controlling this check, and how can we allow a future billing date in this scenario?

In other customers’ tenants we can create billing documents with future billing dates using the same process, but in this customer’s tenant this error appears. I have already reviewed the relevant configuration for billing / posting dates but I still don’t see what is blocking it or how to unlock it.

Screenshots of the process are attached.
Thanks in advance for any hints or SAP Notes!

SD (Sales and Distribution)   SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Sales   SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

entry.title: User Visibility Issue in Manage Sales Document App
entry.content:
Issue Description : 

I'm encountering an unusual authorization-related issue in the Manage Sales Document app that affects user visibility in the people picker/recipient selection area.

Symptoms : 

When SAP_ALL profile is assigned:

  • Users appear correctly in the people picker for approval workflows
  • Recipient selection functions as expected

When SAP_ALL profile is removed:

  • Users no longer appear in the people picker
  • Recipient selection area shows no users or limited user visibility

Environment : 

  • SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud 2023
  • Manage Sales Document Fiori app

Questions : 

Which specific authorization objects or roles are required for users to appear in the recipient selection area for sales document approvals?

Is there a specific authorization object that controls visibility in the people picker that might be included in SAP_ALL but missing from standard sales roles?

Request for Help : 

I'm looking for guidance on the minimum authorization requirements needed for users to be visible in the people picker without relying on SAP_ALL. Any insights on relevant authorization objects.

entry.title: Sales Order Kitting in SAP S4HANA PUBLIC CLOUD
entry.content:
Hi SAP Gurus,

We want to perform sales order kitting process in SAP S4HANA Public cloud without production order cycle.

Header Material is XYZ (This is kit material)

Components are below

A 1 pcs

B 1 pcs

C 1 pcs

We have created a BOM for XYZ with BOM usages as 5 and added 3 components

We want to know what should be general item category group for all the 4 items - it should be NORM ?

When the sales order is created - as per BOM's, components should be exploded, and warehouse needs to post goods issue of components in EWM. We don't want to show kit components on billing documents, only want header Material in billing documents.

Bom components should be reduced by 1 pc each and header material quantity should be generated by 1

Please help me with the process.

@Lakshmipathi 

 

Thanks !

entry.title: BADI/Function Module for Variant Configuration in Sales Order Mass Upload (F4293)
entry.content:
Hello All,

We're using the Import Sales Order using Files app (F4293) for mass sales order creation. We need to upload variant configuration during this mass upload process in S4HANA Cloud Private Edition.

Could anyone advise which BADI and Function Module would be suitable for handling variant configuration in this scenario? Has anyone successfully implemented this? Any guidance on best practices or alternative approaches would be appreciated.

App Works well for standard materials, but does not support variant configuration (VC) for configurable materials (KMAT). So, We plan to enhance this Fiori App to make it work for Variant configuration. 

Any valuable input will be helpful.

Regards,

Sudhir

entry.title: How to integrate external sales forecasts into SAP ERP Cloud and consume them dynamically with SO ?
entry.content:
Context
A customer needs to:

  • Integrate sales forecasts from an external tool (PLM) into SAP S/4HANA Cloud.
  • Use these forecasts for production planning.
  • Automatically consume forecasts when firm Sales Orders are created.

Standard options analyzed and limitations:

  • Scope Item 3NR – Sales Scheduling Agreements
    ➡ Designed for EDI flows (DELFOR/JIT), generating deliveries directly from forecasts without Sales Orders.
    ❌ Does not meet the requirement: the customer wants firm orders based on forecasts, not automatic deliveries.

  • PIR – Planned Independent Requirements
    ✅ Allows forecast integration and consumption via Sales Orders (strategy 40).
    ❌ Limitation: aggregated by material only, losing customer-level granularity (Anaplan sends customer-specific data).

  • Scope Item 1O0 – Planning Apps for Sales
    ✅ Provides Fiori apps for analyzing historical sales and simulating internal forecasts.
    ❌ No integration of external forecasts, no automatic consumption by Sales Orders.

Question to the community
➡ Is there a standard solution or recommended approach in SAP S/4HANA Cloud to:

  • Integrate external, customer-specific forecasts?
  • Dynamically consume them when Sales Orders are created?

Any experience, best practices, or ideas (e.g., APIs, BTP extensions) would be greatly appreciated!

entry.title: POSDTA :While we post WPUUMS IDOC in S/4 it results in error Sold to party could not be determined
entry.content:

Any suggestions please let me know.

entry.title: Credit check triggered again when delivery date is changed-Credit managment
entry.content:
Hello 

when a customer delivery date is changed a new credit approval request is generated.  This occurs even if the $ value of the order has not changed. Multiple credit approvals on an order should only be required if the value of the order has changed as approval has already been granted

entry.title: How to generate Sales Order to Invoice conversion report using tables (limited T-code access)?
entry.content:
I need to generate a report showing the conversion from Sales Orders to Invoices for a complete Sales Organization. My access to T-codes is limited (I can use VA05, VL06O, and VF05). Is there any other T-codes we can use?
Specifically:

  • Sales order-related invoice list for one complete Sales Org
  • Delivery-related invoice list for one complete Sales Org

Can you advise the steps or tables to use for this? I have access to SE16N for table queries. SAP ECC/S4HANA environment.

Vrushali

entry.title: regarding Backorder Processing (BOP)
entry.content:
Hi Experts!

I have a question regarding Backorder Processing (BOP).

Please see the scenario below:

* **Inventory:** 3,000 kg
* **Sales Orders (SOs):**
* SO 1: 1,000 kg (**Credit Blocked**)
* SO 2: 1,000 kg (**Credit Blocked**)
* SO 3: 1,000 kg (**Credit Blocked**)

*Note: When SOs 1 through 3 were initially created, stock was unavailable, resulting in a **zero confirmed quantity** in VA03.*

When **BOP** is executed in this state, the log shows a **Credit Warning and Saved** status for SOs 1 through 3.
However, when checking the schedule lines in **VA03**, the confirmed quantity remains zero.
In contrast, the **Product Available Stock Inquiry App (F7884)** shows 3,000 kg as **Reserved** for future requirements.

The next day, when Sales Order 4 (1,000 kg) is created, it also fails to obtain a confirmed quantity.

We would like to understand the technical reason for this behavior: why is the stock internally reserved or consumed (preventing SO 4 from obtaining it), yet the confirmed quantity remains zero in VA03?

Best Regards,
S-O

entry.title: Freight condition based on PO quantity STO (conversion)
entry.content:
Hello experts,

I have this scneario:

My PO is created based on the quantity the user wants to transfer:

In the creation of the PO, the user inputs the freight value based on the negotiation with the transporter, this condition will be accounted in the post of the delivery:

This value should not change in the course of the process. But, when we create the delivery for this STO, we have to use a conversion to move the stock:

Like I said before, the freight shouldn't change but because of this conversion in the delivery, his value it's been based on the converted field, and not in the value the user inputed:

How can I account the value inputed in the PO, don't matter the quantity of stock I'm transfering (this value change because of a analysis of the actual quantity transferred)?

This is how the FRB1 condition is maintened:

entry.title: STO BRASIL - Determinação direito fiscal ICMS
entry.content:
Olá,

preciso de ajuda com o seguinte cenário: estou realizando uma transferência com origem SP e destino SP, onde fiz a amarração do controle de cópia da minha remessa ao tipo de ordem de vendas e tipo de item ZTRF. Na J_1BSDICA, deixei o direito fiscal de ICMS vazio para esse tipo de item e o amarrei ao código de imposto I0 (com a ideia de que, uma vez vazio na J_1BSDICA, o sistema faria a sequência de acesso de MM para determinar a aba Brasil):

Em MM, determinei que o código de imposto I0 está amarrado ao IVA YS:

Desta forma, imaginei que a determinação do direito fiscal do ICMS seguiria a sequência BRLC, a qual está configurada desta maneira:

O ponto é, da forma com que imaginei a solução, uma exceção criada no grupo 15 por IVA (YS da minha transferência) e material seria relevante para determinação do direito fiscal na remessa. Porém a remessa está sendo criada com direito fiscal que está cadastrado no grupo 20:

Exceção criada no grupo 15 com IVA da transferência + material da operação:

Exceção criada no grupo 20 apenas com material:

Já rodei o programa J_1B_CBT_CONSIST e deletei registros de condições erradas. Já migrei as tabelas da J1BTAX, porém o erro persiste. Minha dúvida é: o que pode estar causando esse comportamento no sistema, de ignorar o grupo 15? Adicionalmente, se alguém tiver sugestões de como trabalhar com um único IVA na STO Brasil e resolver os impostos por exceções, estou aberto. Grato desde já!
